intro: Stenospermation gracile, commonly known as the slender seed plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It is native to tropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and adaptation.
